snippet: American employers added 257,000 jobs in January, showing that signs of economic momentum late last year carried into 2015.
abstract: Labor Department revises upward estimates of job gains in 2014 in November and December, adding additional 147,000 jobs, which brings number of jobs created in 2014 to total that is higher than any year since 1999; department reports employers added seasonally adjusted 257,00 jobs in January; uptick in employment, if it persists, could affect political debate in run up to 2016 presidential election, although analysts are uncertain that wage growth can be sustained.
lead_paragraph: American employers added 257,000 jobs in January, showing that signs of economic momentum late last year carried into 2015.

headline.main: Amid Gains in Jobs and Pay, Americans Rejoin the Work Force
headline.print_headline: Job Count Finds Best 3 Months Since Late 1990s
